my_nodes module¶

The low level module for the bookmark project. It contains a node’s classes and internal database structure

Internal data structure is a tree RootBookmarks. Root node has the name ‘roots’ (that everywhere given in literal form). There are two types of nodes: Folder and Url, node ‘roots’ is a special form of folder Folders have a mutable list of children, urls are leaf nodes. The tree structure keeps a global nodes’ dictionary in the form {key=node_name: value=object: Folder | Url} All nodes have ‘guid’ and ‘parent_guid’ fields for reverse tree search

Instances of the class Folder have the following attributes:

self.guid: str self.parent_guid: str self.name: str self.id_no: int self.date_added: str self.children: list # a list of children entities, Folder and Url instances self.date_modified: str

Instances of the class Url have the following attributes:

self.guid self.parent_guid self.name self.id_no self.date_added: str self.url # URL of the bookmark self.icon # small graphic icon of the URL self.keywords # the keywords for the URL content

class my_nodes.Bookmark(id_no: int = 0, date_added: str = '', **kwargs)¶

Bases: Node

Parent class for Folder and Url classes.

Update params of the Bookmark class.

Returns:

nothing

class my_nodes.RootBookmarks¶

Bases: Node

The root class for bookmark’s tree.

add_node(attr_dict: dict, node_type: bool)¶

Add a folder or url to the tree.

Parameters:

  • attr_dict – dictionary with initial node attributes

  • node_type – True for folder adding, False for url

Returns:

nothing

check_node(node_name: str) → Folder | Url¶

Check if the node is in the global nodes dictionary

:raises NodeNotExists if node_name does not exist

Parameters:

node_name – name of a node

Returns:

the object of node_name, Folder or Url

delete_node(name: str)¶

Delete a node from the current tree.

Raises:

  • NodeNotExists – if node_name does not exist

  • FolderNotEmpty – if node_name folder is not empty

Parameters:

name – node name to delete

Returns:

nothing

duplicate_name(name: str) → str¶

Check if a name already exists in the global node dict. Replace a duplicate name with a name(i)’ where i = 1,2, … n.

Parameters:

name – node name for checking

Returns:

new unique node name or input name if it is not duplicated

get_node(node_name: str) → dict¶

Get a node content. Replace children objects with their names for folder children list

:raises raise NodeNotExists if node_name does not exist

Parameters:

node_name – node name

Returns:

dictionary {field_name: field_value} of the node

get_parent(node_name: str) → Folder¶

Get a parent node object of the current node

Raises:

NodeNotExists – if node_name does not exist

Parameters:

node_name – current node name

Returns:

parent node object

update_node(name: str, attr_dict: dict)¶

Update a folder or url of the internal tree.

Parameters:

  • name – updating node name

  • attr_dict – dictionary with the updating fields

Returns:

nothing
